Posts.Content: Hi i finished chemo 4 weeks ago.  I had 6 fec and kept all the hair on my head, I've got eyelashes and thin eyebrows.  It was definitely worth it for me.  As time went on I got more confident and washed my hair more often.  it does take a lot longer and is hard, particularly first 15 mins but I took a friend and theI'd job wS to distract me.  Fit is really important.  There was only one other person using cold cap at same time as me but she also kept her hair.  If you have any more questions just ask.

Posts.Content: Hi Ange, I found number 3 the hardest emotionally and told my husband I couldn't do any more and wanted to stop, but as you have found you just move on and get on with it.  I'm 3 weeks after my last chemo and realised I don't have to carry the I'm a chemo patient around anymore!  I've also dyed my hair today - looking a bit more like me.  Not yet straightened it as my  teenage daughter has taken possession of my straighteners whilst I've been having chemo - don't think I will get them back!  Good luck with the rest of your treatment.  Janet x
Posts.Title: coming out of that dark tunnel.

Posts.Content: Hi Girls I'm new to the group.  I had my 2nd fec on Thursday and like most of you I'm having 3 fec and 3 T.  I'm using cold cap and so far I still have my hair.  my children are doing exams so I've tried to keep life as normal as possible.  Ive been back at work on the Monday after treatment, but have my own office and can control my own work so it's easier for me than most.  I was very sick on day of first fec so they altered my meds, this time no sickness but terrible headaches.  I love spin classes and have managed to keep going but probably only 80%, it really helps as I can visualize the poison leaving my body when working out.  I've found your comments a great help and painted my nails dark grey tonight.
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks Annie Yes I'm having it in the back of my hand, they are using a warm pad to keep it warm.    I will try massaging it with oils.  My hair is naturally curly, I've always straightened it but now I just wash it and leave it.  I haven't combed it since my first chemo but so far it looks ok and its so much quicker in the morning. Still seems a long slog until it finishes.

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothy, I was down to have 3 FEC and 3 T, been today for my pre chemotherapy appt on Thursday and was told that the Proffessor had reviewed my case and decided I only needed 6 FEC.  It was put to me that this was a good thing and was because my tumour was only 2.5cms and I didn't need something as aggressive as T.  Not sure what to think, having read what everyone is saying about T I was thinking that was better.  Will look into it a bit more and have some questions for my next appointment. Posts.Content: Hi girls I hope everyone is feeling better today.  I've got a question that I hope you can help me with.  I'm 14 days post 2nd Fec and my arm where I had it injected is really tender to touch and it  hurts it I twist it.  Has anyone else experienced this? Posts.Content: Thank you Hev, Well done on getting through all 6, I can't wait to be there - its quite a journey as you said!  I will be half way next week. Janet
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks Karen, I have had a look and will give WOW a go, it might give me a few more weeks whilst its just roots.  I've read  sometimes Cold Cap and chemo stop the hair growing, thats definitely not the case for me - it seems to be growing faster.  I think by the end I will have the dipped hair look.  I definitely recommend you give the Cold Cap a go - It is horrible to start with, the strap made me gag and it felt claustrophobic as it was so tight - but like everyone says if you give it 10 minutes you get past all that.  My hair has survived two rounds of FEC and I'm beginning to believe it will work, so far lost very little.  I also bought a silk pillowcase and wash my hair only twice a week - used to be every day.  Head is itchy but for me its a small price.  Also take pain relief before you put the cold cap on and after as it does give you a headache. I think the headaches were from one of the antisickness drugs - so am hoping today they can give me a different drug.  Good luck
